https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The element of stratigraphy that deals with the description and systematic organization of the rocks of the Earth's crust into distinctive named units based on the lithological character of the rocks and their stratigraphic relations. In the petroleum industry, lithostratigraphy specifically refers to the study and correlation of strata to elucidate Earth's history on the basis of their lithology or the nature of the well log response, mineral content, grain size, texture, and colour of rocks.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf, 2011) and Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary.
